title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1154.5 - Unauthorized parking and storage tariff
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1154.5 - Unauthorized parking and storage tariff

State Regulations

Unless otherwise provided in a lease or other agreement, no
person shall use any area of a terminal (other than the public parking and
storage areas), for parking and storage without permission. When the manager
deems that such use will not interfere with the operation of a terminal, and
such permission is granted, the charge for such use may be double the rates
provided at such terminal for the public parking and storage areas thereat, this charge to apply from the time so parked or stored at the terminal. If, notwithstanding the above prohibition, a person uses such areas for parking or
storage as aforesaid, without first obtaining such permission, then the manager
shall have authority to order the same to be removed and stored at the expense
of the owner thereof, without liability for damage thereto arising from or out
of such removal or storage. The above rate shall apply for the time same has
been so parked or stored at a terminal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes

1154.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
